quotes.quote: Love is a trap. When it appears, we see only its light, not its shadows.
A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.
Knowing where the trap is—that's the first step in evading it.
The greatest trap in our life is not success, popularity or power, but self-rejection.
Freedom is for honest people. No man who is not himself honest can be free – he is his own trap.
The thing that gives you power also traps you.
Bitterness is the trap that snares the hunter.
Judgment traps you within the limitations of your comparisons. It inhibits freedom.
The real trap of fame is its irresistibility.
Man is the only kind of varmint sets his own trap, baits it, then steps in it.
Debt is a trap which man sets and baits himself, and then deliberately gets into.
It's really easy to fall into the trap of bellieving what we do is more important than what we are. Of course, it's the opposite that's true: What we are ultimately determines what we do!
We have to learn to be our own best friends because we fall too easily into the trap of being our own worst enemies.
Looks can be deceiving but let's not fall into the looks trap.
Life's a trap, you get caught in whatever direction you go.
The real purpose of books is to trap the mind into doing its own thinking.
Worry about being respected, never worry about being liked because that's the trap.
Somewhere in the depths of soltitude, beyond wilderness and freedom, lay the trap of madness.
But difficult situations and wrong choices conspire to trap us in hopelessness.
Creative ideas in people's minds, but they fall into the trap of fear or rejection. Create a free judgment Wednesday and you spawn a thread creation.
We cannot leave the trap until we know we are in it.
Procrastination is the soul rebelling against entrapment.
Hate traps us by binding us too tightly to our adversary.
Building a better mousetrap merely results in smarter mice.
The whole idea of motivation is a trap, forget motivation, just do it.
To trap one's self-suffering is to risk being devoured from the inside.
Life is not fair, it never was and it is now and it won’t ever be. Do not fall into the trap. The entitlement trap, of feeling like you’re a victim. You are not.
